nodes.bodyText: This should mention that 0 will mean bars are always shown
This field isn't accessed outside this class. Why does it have a getter?

Game ticks would be a better unit of measurement since that's the unit of time this change actually operates on. That would also let you drop the Instant.now() duration comparisons in favor of using client.getTickCount().
startUp() should be removed if it contains no code.
Usually we prefer short names since there is not much room for it in the side panel. When you hover over it it will show the description anyway. This would probably just show Show amount...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -54,14 +56,25 @@ default boolean enableSkillIcon()
 
 	@ConfigItem(
 		keyName = "enableRestorationBars",
-		name = "Show restores",
-		description = "Visually shows how much will be restored to your status bar."
+		name = "Show amount of hitpoints and prayer restored",

nodes.bodyText: Instead of adding and removing the overlay various places, you can keep the overlay enabled the entire time and return; from it early when the combat has timed out.
This must be run on the client thread or will error.
This should be named something which resembles what it is doing like  checkStatusBars
I think you can just check this above and do an early return if it is 0, since it isn't necessary to check anything else then?
